alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Central Oregon Coast Range; North Oregon Coast Range (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 5:40AM PDT until July 05 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HOT, DRY, UNSTABLE, AND BREEZY CONDITIONS TO IMPACT MUCH OF SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON AND NORTHWEST OREGON THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 602 AND 603... * AFFECTED AREA... In Oregon, - Fire Weather Zone 602 North Oregon Coast Range, and - Fire Weather Zone 603 East Slopes of the Central Oregon Coast Range. * TIMING...Until 6 PM PDT Wednesday. * WINDS...Northeast 3 to 7 mph with gusts up to 15 mph this morning, becoming north to northwest 5 to 9 mph with gusts up to 20 mph this afternoon. West winds developing through the Coast Range gaps around 4 or 5 PM, increasing to 6 to 12 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. Humidity recoveries will be much better tonight than it was Tuesday night. * HAINES...5 (moderate). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible, especially from established fires. Use extra caution with potential ignition sources, especially in grassy areas. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Check with your local fire agency to see whether burning and/or firework restrictions are in place. Even if burning is legal, do not leave any type of fire unattended.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Central Oregon Coast Range; North Oregon Coast Range
